argument.name: code
argument.description: A character string that can be interpreted as Xbasic or Xdialog commands.

page.description: Registers code to be executed when an Alpha Five database is opened
page.discussion: ON_DATABASE_INIT() executes the Code_String when Alpha Anywhere opens the database. Limitations: Desktop applications only.

section.title: Example
section.description: Both the following examples display the following dialog box.
The first example defines Xdialog code that is executed.
section.example: dim code as C Code = ui_msg_box("Hello","It was nice of you to return") %code% on_database_init(code)

section.description: The second example defines Xbasic code that is executed.
section.example: dim code as C code = "ui_msg_box(" + quote("Hello") + ", " + quote("It was nice of you to return") + ")" on_database_init(code)
